subject: Management
title: Decision Rights Clarity
description: A micro-lesson that makes Decision Rights Clarity usable.

hook.text: Three managers all thought they owned the pricing decision. The product launched with no price set.

buildup.text: Unclear ownership is the hidden killer of fast group decisions.

discovery.text: RACI frameworks clarify: who decides, who advises, who's informed, who executes.

twist.text: Under pressure, ambiguity multiplies. Nobody acts because everyone assumes someone else will.

climax.text: Before the crisis: name one decision-maker per domain. During the crisis: they call it.

punchline.text: If everyone owns it, nobody owns it.

quiz.question: Why is decision rights clarity critical under pressure?
options: Ambiguity causes paralysis when nobody knows who should act
It ensures the most senior person always decides
Clear rights eliminate the need for any discussion
